quotes.t: In the Imagist model, the writer is a sculptor. Technique consists of chipping away everything {qword}superfluous{/qword} in order to reveal the essential form within. "It took you ninety-seven words to do it," Pound is reported to have remarked to a young literary aspirant who had handed him a new poem. "I find it could have been managed in fifty-six."
Oddly, despite the preponderance of {qword}superfluous{/qword} words, the book has no glossary, which is a must for an introductory audience.

Twenty years ago, baby boomers were written about as if every one of them had as a life goal making enough money to accumulate the same {qword}superfluous{/qword} material objects that everyone else had.

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}superfluus{/it}, literally, running over, from {it}superfluere{/it} to overflow, from {it}super-{/it} + {it}fluere{/it} to flow {ma}{mat|fluid|}{/ma}
shortdef: exceeding what is sufficient or necessary : extra
